main event: An unidentified object described as round and white was observed in Charleston, Maine, on May 6, 1955, for approximately 30 seconds before disappearing.
interesting points: The initial sighting on May 13, 1955, involved a flaming object falling from the sky,The object was observed straight down,The witness reported the object to be approximately 10 feet in diameter.,A check with the SAC liaison officer verified that an aircraft was conducting a training exercise at the time., The summary included multiple potential explanations including balloon, aircraft, and astronomical objects.
